intro: Lightfootia graminicola, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 cm. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions.
